author: Matthew
text:
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness,
For they shall be filled.

author: Luke
text:
Blessed are you who hunger now,
For you shall be filled.

author: Luke
text:
He has filled the hungry with good things,
And the rich He has sent away empty.

author: Psalms
text:
For He satisfies the longing soul,
And fills the hungry soul with goodness.

author: Proverbs
text:
The person who labors, labors for himself,
For his hungry mouth drives him on.

author: Proverbs
text:
A satisfied soul loathes the honeycomb,
But to a hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.

author: Steve Jobs
text: Stay Hungry. Stay Foolish.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
reference: Don Quixote, Part II, Chapter V (1615)
text: Hunger is the best sauce in the world.

author: St. Augustine
text: The soul remains restless—and hungry—until it rests in God.

author: A.W. Tozer
text: God fills those who desire Him deeply; shallow desire leads to shallow faith.

author: Viktor Frankl
text: Man’s deepest hunger is not pleasure, but meaning.

author: Marcus Aurelius
text: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.

author: Marcus Aurelius
text: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.

author: Seneca
text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
note: Often attributed; included for its cultural usage.

author: Epictetus
text: Some things are in our control and others not.

author: Aristotle
text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
note: Commonly paraphrased from Aristotle; keep short.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
text: It is not the critic who counts... the credit belongs to the man who is actually in the arena.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
text: The best prize that life offers is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.

author: Abraham Lincoln
text: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
note: Often attributed; included for its cultural usage.

author: George Washington
text: Discipline is the soul of an army. It makes small numbers formidable.

author: Plutarch
text: The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a fire to be kindled.

author: Socrates
text: The unexamined life is not worth living.

author: Thomas Jefferson
text: I’m a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work the more I have of it.

author: John Adams
text: Patience and perseverance have a magical effect before which difficulties disappear.

author: Frederick Douglass
text: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.

author: William James
text: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.

author: Thomas Carlyle
text: Work is the grand cure of all the maladies and miseries that ever beset mankind.

author: Rudyard Kipling
text: If you can meet with Triumph and Disaster and treat those two impostors just the same...

author: William Ernest Henley
text: I am the master of my fate: I am the captain of my soul.

author: Men of Hunger
text: Stop talking about what a real man is. Pick a hard thing and do it—today.

author: Men of Hunger
text: A man becomes dangerous when he keeps promises to himself.

author: Men of Hunger
text: Let your life get loud from results. Keep your mouth quiet and your hands busy.
